Title: Data Analyst - 24 month contract
Description:
Description

At Audible, we believe stories have the power to transform lives. It’s why we work with some of the world’s leading creators to produce and share audio storytelling with our millions of global listeners. We are dreamers and inventors who come from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to empower and inspire each other. Imagine your future with us.

About This Role

Based in Berlin, Audible GmbH is looking for an enthusiastic Data Analyst. You will be responsible for surfacing data-driven results and insights for the wider Analytics Team as well as the core marketing function. In this position you will provide operational, economic, and financial analysis to frame data driven decisions - and implement KPIs and scorecards to track initiative progress/performance to encourage a focus on results and execution.

This position is open through a 24-month contract.

About You

Working with various teams, you will be exposed to a wide range of functions. From engineering, data science to marketing. You will provide your knowledge and skills to be a trusted analyst to the wider analytics team as well as, to our business stakeholders. You will be able to conduct multiple tasks simultaneously with support from leadership. Critical to the success of this role is your ability to develop insightful analysis, work effectively as part of a cross-functional team, and transform data to insight.

As a Data Analyst, you will...


Create and maintain basic reporting solutions using SQL and standard BI tools
Assist in developing regular performance reports and dashboards
Support data quality checks and basic process improvements
Help identify trends in key business metrics
Collaborate with Business stakeholders to understand and address business questions
Document analyses / Insights and maintain clear documentation of work
Support the analytics team in day-to-day reporting needs


About Audible

Audible is the leading producer and provider of audio storytelling. We spark listeners’ imaginations, offering immersive, cinematic experiences full of inspiration and insight to enrich our customers daily lives. We are a global company with an entrepreneurial spirit. We are dreamers and inventors who are passionate about the positive impact Audible can make for our customers and our neighbors. This spirit courses throughout Audible, supporting a culture of creativity and inclusion built on our People Principles and our mission to build more equitable communities in the cities we call home.

Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related)
1+ year of experience in a data analysis role
Proficiency in SQL: intermediate query writing
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel: Pivot tables, basic functions, data manipulation
Proficiency in Analysis: Basic statistical concepts and business metrics
Business fluency in English (written and spoken)
Experience with visualization tools: Basic reporting and dashboard creation on Tableau, QuickSight, or PowerBI


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with Python or R
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Good communication skills and ability to explain analytical findings
Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Experience working with large datasets


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

m/w/d

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Company - Audible GmbH

Job ID: A2913273

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Contentpass offers website publishers a GDPR-compliant solution to increase digital revenues while enabling users to visit their favorite sites ad- and tracking-free with our cross-publisher subscription. Our network includes over 500 publishers in Europe, such as Axel Springer, Burda, Hearst and Prisa. We are a fast growing startup now expanding into other countries.




With privacy at heart, we always make sure to only collect the absolute minimum of data. Everything happening on our partner’s websites is anonymized, rigorously sampled, and free of any user-identifiable information. Still, as our technology powers a few billion page impressions every month, there’s vast amounts of data to identify e.g. room for performance improvements under certain circumstances.




Join us as a Senior Data Analyst to work right along with the founders to shape our business strategy and product development.




Responsibilities:

Analyze: Deep dive into business, traffic and behavioral data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Strategize: Collaborate with the founders to develop and implement data-driven strategies that not only optimize core metrics like signup rates and subscriber retention but processes, like e.g. publisher onboarding.
Develop: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of our growth initiatives and product development efforts.
Monitor: Set up and manage monitoring systems to ensure accuracy, reliability, and privacy compliance of all datasets as well as a smooth user experience.
Communicate: Clearly and effectively communicate data insights, recommendations and best-practices to your fellow contentpals.




Qualifications:

Seniority: At least 5 years of experience in similar roles is a must.
Analytical mindset: Strong analytical skills with the ability to extract meaningful insights from large-scale, anonymized datasets.
Technical proficiency: Deep knowledge of data analysis and manipulation languages (e.g. SQL, R or Python), data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Studio or Grafana), as well as data platforms (e.g. BigQuery, ClickHouse, or Snowflake)
Predictive Analytics: Hands-on experience with statistical modeling and advanced analytics techniques.
Growth hacking mentality: A passion for user acquisition, engagement, and retention, with a proactive approach to identifying growth opportunities. 
Communication skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English) with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Startup spirit: A self-starter with a strong work ethic, a can-do attitude, and a willingness to roll up your sleeves and get things done. Always eager to learn.




Bonus points:

Entrepreneurial or Web-Developer experience 
Familiarity with subscription business models and digital content monetization strategies.
Background in online publishing or media.




Benefits:

Impact: Make a real difference in a fast-growing startup and shape the future of digital publishing.
Growth: Accelerate your career by working directly with experienced founders and taking on significant responsibilities in a fast growing company.
Learning: Continuously expand your knowledge and skills in a dynamic and innovative environment.
Flexibility: Enjoy a flexible work environment in a full remote setup (CET +/-2 preferred).
Culture: Be part of a passionate and supportive team that values collaboration and open communication.
Ownership: Besides a competitive salary we also offer equity




Interested in becoming a contentpal? Please send your current CV to jobs@contentpass.de. Plus, ideally, a possible start date as well as your salary expectations. Let's go for it! We are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
SLAY, founded in December 2022, has swiftly made its mark in the mobile world. The company developed 5 apps and games that reached the #1 spot in the App Store across 3 continents.




Backed by some of the world's most esteemed investors, including Accel, Kevin Weil, Riccardo Zacconi, Scott Belsky, and Ilkka Paananen, SLAY is rapidly growing and reaching millions of users.




Our mission is to create digital life through AI and become the leading company for virtual friends that live, grow and evolve like humans—starting with Pengu. Pengu has become the biggest AI character app with its own IP in the US and Europe.


Tasks


• Data Analysis and Insights: Enable tactical and strategic decision-making by providing insightful analyses, developing predictive models, and creating dashboards.




• Predictive Analytics: Build and interpret predictive models to forecast Lifetime Value (LTV) and user behavior, optimizing marketing spend and strategies.




• Attribution Modeling: Implement and refine attribution models—including probabilistic and multi-touch models—working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data and other privacy-centric attribution methods.




• A/B Testing: Design, analyze, and interpret the results of A/B tests to inform marketing strategies and improve campaign performance.




• Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, user acquisition, and data engineering teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions that drive business objectives.


Requirements


Experience:





3+ years in a role such as Data Analyst or Data Scientist with a strong emphasis on marketing analytics.


Currently employed in a gaming company, actively addressing similar challenges is a plus.





Technical Proficiency:





Strong expertise in SQL and experience with data analysis tools.


Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python or R).


Experience with cloud data warehouses is a plus.





Predictive Analytics:





Experience with predictive modeling techniques and forecasting LTV.


Familiarity with machine learning concepts and algorithms relevant to marketing analytics.





Attribution Modeling:





Strong knowledge of attribution models, including probabilistic and multi-touch models.


Familiarity with mobile attribution challenges like SKAdNetwork (SKAN).





Data Visualization:





Proficiency with visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.





Marketing Knowledge:





Deep understanding of performance marketing, user acquisition strategies, and performance metrics (e.g., CPI, CPA, ROAS, K-factor).





Analytical Mindset:





Strong problem-solving skills and a data-driven approach.


Ability to handle complex datasets and extract actionable insights.





Communication Skills:





Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


Ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.





Adaptability:





Proven ability to deliver high-quality results in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst / Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have a passion for technology and a drive to make a positive impact? Join NeuroNation and help us shape the future of brain training!




About NeuroNation

NeuroNation is a leading brain training platform used by over 28 million people worldwide. We collaborate closely with scientists and universities to achieve the best results possible. Our engaging apps have received awards from major health insurance companies, such as the AOK, funded by the German Federal Ministry of Health. Also, NeuroNation has been awarded by Apple and Google. Our medical app can be prescribed by doctors in Germany, while costs are covered by the public health insurance.




The Role

In this dynamic role, you'll be a key member of our product team, driving data-driven initiatives and developing product features forward. You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including backend and mobile developers, to ensure new features are implemented smoothly and according to our high standards. Your strong analytical skills and technical knowledge will be essential in translating business needs into actionable solutions.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the Growth and Product teams to support data-driven decisions for our mobile and web applications.
Analyze data and key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify opportunities for performance optimization.
Conduct deep analyses on user behavior (data mining) to uncover patterns and provide actionable insights.
Maintain a growth mindset—constantly seek learning opportunities to enhance your skills and the team's capabilities.
Act as a key support contact for BI-related topics within the organization.
Assist in managing the data warehouse and building internal reports to inform strategic decisions.
Work closely with Marketing, Customer Care, and CRM departments to ensure cohesive data insights across teams.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends in business intelligence and data analytics.




You're a perfect fit if you:

Have 1-2 years of experience in a technical or data-focused role (e.g., BI Analyst, Data Analyst).
Have been part of or closely collaborated with a product team delivering digital consumer or B2B products.
Have studied Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
Possess strong experience in SQL, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, or similar database tools.
Have a passion for learning and staying current with the latest technologies in data analytics.
Are located in Berlin, Germany.
Possess strong problem-solving skills and an analytical mindset.
Speak English with excellent written and oral communication skills.
Are a team player who enjoys supporting and collaborating with colleagues.




Bonus points for:

You have advanced knowledge of R or Python
You have experience conceptualising and executing A/B tests.
You have been working on mobile applications
You have a basic knowledge of German, French, Spanish or Italian.




What we offer:

The opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of millions of people.
Work on cutting-edge technology that is used by a global audience.
A flexible work environment with core working hours of 9:30 am - 4:30 pm CET.




Don't hesitate to apply!

We're looking for talented individuals who are passionate about what we do. Submit your application and tell us why you'd be a great fit for NeuroNation!

Title: BI / Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Distribusion is the world’s leading ground transportation marketplace and gives travelers seamless access to ground transportation online, from search to ticket purchase. We have built a cutting-edge B2B technology platform that connects bus, rail, and ferry operators in 70+ countries with the biggest online retailers, including Google Maps and Booking.com.

We are shaping the future of travel and building the largest global network of transport providers and retailers. We are one of the fastest growing startups in travel, backed by two leading VCs (TQ Ventures & Lightrock), and now, following our recent $80m Series C funding, we are ready to push beyond.

As a BI/Data Analyst for Content at Distribusion, you will play a key role in managing and optimizing strategies to ensure the accuracy, freshness and completeness of content data—such as schedules, prices, and offers—so that we can consistently deliver the best and most competitive offers to our partners. Your work will be crucial in enabling seamless content integration, enhancing data quality and supporting informed decision-making across the organization.

What you will do:


Lead Data Enhancement: Take ownership of continuously enhancing our business intelligence solutions and data models on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You'll leverage advanced data analysis techniques to drive accurate insights, elevate data quality, and support impactful decision-making across the business
Ensure Data Integrity: Own the review and assessment process for the accuracy, freshness, and completeness of cached content data (schedules, prices, offers). Your work will directly impact the reliability of key business data used for strategic decisions
Optimize Data Integration Strategies: Drive the optimization of strategies for scraping, caching, and integrating content data from carrier systems into our platform. You'll ensure that our databases are consistently complete, accurate, and up-to-date, empowering teams to make data-driven decisions
Cross-Team Collaboration & Impact: Collaborate closely with engineering, data, and product teams to resolve content-related issues and proactively implement improvements that enhance system performance and business outcomes



Workplace:

We are mainly looking for this role to be based within Germany, preferably in our HQ in Berlin. We are a remote-first company, with teams located around the Globe and open for talent based elsewhere.

Who you are:


You bring at least 3 years of experience in Data (BI or Engineering) roles
You possess expertise in clustering techniques, regression analysis (linear, logistic), time-series forecasting, feature engineering, A/B testing, and spatial data analysis
Experienced in interconnecting datasets through join operations, data merging, dimensionality reduction, and network analysis to derive actionable insights
You are very comfortable with data manipulation tools such as SQL and Pandas
You have hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio
You are familiar with OOP concepts. Additional experience working with Python is a nice-to-have. Ruby is a plus
Additional experience with Airflow is more than welcome
Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud, is an advantage
You are a team player and enjoy working in interdisciplinary teams
You have an analytical mindset and a high degree of problem-solving skills



What you can expect:


You will join a fast-paced travel tech company and take on a rapidly growing industry.
You will take on ownership and responsibility from day one and have a direct impact on the success of the company.
We value agility! We’re constantly updating our tech stack and offer the best possible tools to ensure all of our in-house engineers, partners, and carriers benefit from cutting-edge, efficient solutions.
You will work with global companies. Our product attracts the biggest names in travel technology, such as Booking.com and Google Maps, and national carriers like Amtrak, Deutsche Bahn, Renfe, and SNCF.
You will join an international team of talented and driven people with a clear mission. Expect your colleagues to inspire, support and challenge you every day!
We offer flexible and remote working conditions, relocation opportunities and career growth in a small and developing company.



Our hiring team:

Your Talent Partner (TP) and point of contact is Ceren Volkan, and the Hiring Manager (HM) is Renato.

For any queries, please reach out to your Talent Partner at (talent@distribusion.com).

Do you want to work on a product that is used by millions of people daily with a high load, availability and scalability, and the most advanced technology? Come join us!

  • You have an analytical mindset and a high degree of problem-solving skills


What you can expect:

  • You will join a fast-paced travel tech company and take on a rapidly growing industry.
  • You will take on ownership and responsibility from day one and have a direct impact on the success of the company.
  • We value agility! We’re constantly updating our tech stack and offer the best possible tools to ensure all of our in-house engineers, partners, and carriers benefit from cutting-edge, efficient solutions.
  • You will work with global companies. Our product attracts the biggest names in travel technology, such as Booking.com and Google Maps, and national carriers like Amtrak, Deutsche Bahn, Renfe, and SNCF.
  • You will join an international team of talented and driven people with a clear mission. Expect your colleagues to inspire, support and challenge you every day!
  • We offer flexible and remote working conditions, relocation opportunities and career growth in a small and developing company.


Our hiring team:

Your Talent Partner (TP) and point of contact is Ceren Volkan, and the Hiring Manager (HM) is Renato.

For any queries, please reach out to your Talent Partner at (talent@distribusion.com).

Do you want to work on a product that is used by millions of people daily with a high load, availability and scalability, and the most advanced technology? Come join us!

Title: Analytics Lead, Consumer, Ads
Description:
Job Description

About Consumer Analytics at Wolt

As the name Consumer Analytics implies, this team aims to provide reliable data insights that drive informed decision-making, empower Wolt's product organization, and foster a data-driven culture through collaboration and education, ultimately inspiring teams and building value for the Consumer group.

Within the Consumer Analytics Vertical, we are currently looking for an Analytics Lead for Ads.

About The Ads Domain

The AdTech team is a team that owns the end-to-end experience of advertising at Wolt. They build tools for merchants and brands that can offer visibility and increased performance. Their long-term goal is to create a unified Wolt + DoorDash advertising platform that will benefit both global and local clients.

About The Role

As a Data Science Manager at Wolt, you will be leading a team of two Senior Data Scientists and work closely with the Analytics Engineering team, Product, Business, and Operation teams driving product improvements and adoption. Your role will involve diving into our data to solve crucial business problems hands-on as well.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst the chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using Data Science to affect AdTech, we're looking for someone like you!

Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
7+ years of experience in Data Analytics or Data Science.
2+ years of experience in the leadership role.
Experience with the Ads - we’ll pay lots of attention to this experience 🙏
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing (A/B testing), and experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Working Student Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
As a Working Student Data Analyst (F/X/M), you have a unique opportunity to revolutionize the financial industry. With our platform Pulsproject we enable SMEs to get business loans without the hassle of a complicated bank check. In our highly dedicated and motivated team, you will analyze our customer data. Join our team in Berlin and start your career at a young and dynamic FinTech company.


Tasks



Data collection and cleansing: Collect, cleanse, and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data quality and completeness.


Data analysis: Analyze data using data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.


Data Interpretation: understandably interpret results and provide clear recommendations for action to team members and customers.


Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure data integrity.



Requirements



You are currently studying for a Bachelor's (last year) or Master's degree in the field of Computer science / Finance / Business Analytics in Berlin.


Proficiency with data analysis tools and software such as Excel.


Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and find creative solutions.


Fluent in written and spoken English, with German language skills rounding out the profile.


Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality work.


Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to changing priorities.



Benefits



Learn from a incredibly talented team of smart, international individuals who are always ready to learn, discover, and implement


An environment that offers room for personal and professional development


A centrally located office in Berlin City West


Being part of a fearless pioneering company that relentlessly strives for new technological breakthroughs


The opportunity to work with smart and passionate people to develop fantastic products


A pet-friendly environment


Salary progression based on length of service with the company


Challenging projects. Exceptional experiences.





At Puls Technologies GmbH, we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be part of an exhilarating expedition that is reshaping the very fabric of the SME landscape. If you're passionate about driving growth, igniting innovation, and leaving a lasting impact, your adventure begins here!




You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart, talented people in the heart of Berlin's City West.




Get in touch with us now!




Puls Technologies GmbH

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
PAUL Tech AG is a technology leader in the real estate industry with the mission to make buildings carbon neutral. Our proprietary technology, consisting of IoT-enabled hardware and AI-supported software, permanently optimizes water-bearing systems in buildings. This reduces CO2 emissions and energy costs. Everyone benefits: owners, operators, occupants and the climate. At Paul, we are researchers, developers and practitioners with the common goal of developing intelligent solutions for buildings to combat climate change.

Therefore we are looking for you to drive our scaling as

Data Analyst (m/f/d) in Berlin

Core Responsibilities

Strategic Stakeholder Collaboration


Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs, and objectives



Analytical Problem Framing


Analytical outlook to frame the right questions while diving deep into business domains and processes



Data Integration and Collaboration


Connect data from various sources, collaborating with product managers and engineers to develop comprehensive data solutions



Data Model Development


Develop robust and clean data models, ensuring high-quality data thereby leading high-quality analytics



Insightful Data Communication


Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support product development and decision-making



Data-Driven Decision Support


Support the business decision-making process, by generating analytical solutions by leveraging exploratory data analysis and hypothesis based “proof of concept” framework



The Skillset We Are Looking For


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably within a business context
Strong zeal for Data crunching and wrangling
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact



What You Can Expect From Us


A meaningful job that contributes to global CO2 savings
A collegial working atmosphere with short decision paths
A permanent contract with an above-average salary
30 days vacation per calendar year plus 24.12. and 31.12. off
Company private health insurance and supplementary pension
Company fitness subsidy in your region
Regular company events to which you are very welcome
Tram ticket as well as drinks and fruit in our offices



Would you like to become part of us? Then apply here.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.




Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.


Aufgaben


Deine Leidenschaft





Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kund:innen


Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren


Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung


Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen





Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.


Qualifikation


Dein Talent





Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)


Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung


Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics


Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin


Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil


Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region





Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!


Benefits


Unser Versprechen




Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.




Das erwartet Dich bei uns:





Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.


Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.


Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.


Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.


Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.


Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.


Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.


Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.


Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.





Schau Dir unsere CBTW Spotify Playlist an und erhalte einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A




Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du an der Reihe - Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more

  • Develop your research skills.
  • Avoid the long commute.
  • Work from the comfort of your home office.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Ideal Candidate

  • Fluent in English and German.
  • Excellent research skills.
  • Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
  • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
  • Analytical mindset.


Job Requirements

  • Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
  • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
  • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
  • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
  • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
  • All work must be of an independent nature.



Apply Online Today!

Title: Staff Data Analyst, DATA (m/f/d)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure and data models enables you to identify needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


#Data

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here

JR102528

Title: Data Analyst m/w/d (Berlin)
Description:
WILLKOMMEN BEI JUNIQE

Wir sind JUNIQE: Seit 2014 bringen wir Design, Kreativität und Inspiration in das Leben unserer Kund:innen. Jetzt haben wir eine neue Mission: Wir wollen der weltweit führende Online-Marktplatz werden, auf dem Creator ihre Designs selbst veröffentlichen und erfolgreich vertreiben können.

Du willst unsere Mission zum weltweit führenden Online-Marktplatz Vollgas vorantreiben?

Daten sind Deine Leidenschaft und Du hast richtig Bock, große Datenmengen in automatisierte Prozesse zu überführen?

Dann bist DU bei uns genau richtig!

Für unser Büro im Herzen Berlins suchen wir DICH als Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Voll- oder Teilzeit.

DEINE CHALLENGE

Als unser:e Data Analyst:in bist Du verantwortlich für die strategische Analyse und Automatisierung von 1st- und 3rd-Party Daten, um nachhaltiges Wachstum zu ermöglichen. Du glaubst an die Anwendung von LLMs, Machine Learning und Automatisierung, um datengetrieben unsere Kernprozesse im Marketing und Sales zu optimieren.

Dein Verantwortungsbereich Umfasst


Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung & Automatisierung: Entwicklung, Steuerung und Skalierung von Kernprozessen durch effiziente Analyse und Automatisierung
Datenintegration & Verknüpfung: Zusammenführung relevanter Datenquellen zur Steigerung der Effizienz
Reporting & Insights: Erstellung von Dashboards und Reports zur datenbasierten Entscheidungsfindung
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit & KI-Innovation: Entwicklung und Implementierung moderner Technologien in enger Abstimmung mit anderen Teams, vor allem Marketing, Produkt und Softwareentwicklung
Technologie- und Trendanalyse: Evaluierung neuer Trends zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung von Datenanalyseprozessen


DEIN PROFIL


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit analytischem Schwerpunkt, Data Science oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Du hast Interesse, unternehmerisch zu arbeiten und Einfluss auf die Business-Performance zu nehmen
Du hast Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit großen Datenmengen und deren Verknüpfung aus verschiedenen Quellen
Du hast verschiedene LLM ausprobiert und Machine Learning operativ eingebunden
Du bringst fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung mit Data Warehousing mit
Du besitzt grundlegende Python-Kenntnisse zur Automatisierung von Analysen und Datenflüssen
Du denkst analytisch und kannst komplexe Daten in strategische Handlungsempfehlungen übersetzen
Du hast Interesse an neuen Technologien und bist motiviert, Dich stetig weiterzuentwickeln
Du hast idealerweise Erfahrung mit Performance-Marketing und SEA, dies ist jedoch nicht zwingend erforderlich
Du bist kommunikationsstark und hast Erfahrung in interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit


ARBEITE MIT JUNIQE

Von Tech-Support bis People-Power: Wir bei JUNIQE glauben, dass Kreativität und Mut der Motor echter Veränderung sind. Bei uns kannst Du Deine eigenen Ideen umsetzen und richtig was bewegen.

Unser mega nettes & internationales Team aus Experten verschiedener Fachbereiche gibt jeden Tag alles, um erstklassige Erlebnisse für unsere Kund:innen und Creator zu erzielen. Bei uns ist Teamwork gefragt: wir inspirieren, unterstützen und fordern uns gegenseitig. Wir bringen Erfahrung mit ein oder probieren auch einfach mal Neues aus - Hauptsache Vollgas und mit viel Herzblut!

Unser lichtdurchflutetes und kreativ gestaltetes Büro bietet viel Platz für eine inspirierende Arbeitsatmosphäre. Ob voller Fokus in einem unserer Meetingräume oder Entspannung bei der Pause in unserer bunten Küche.

WARUM DU MIT UNS ARBEITEN SOLLTEST?


Wir sind ein profitables Familienunternehmen und unabhängig von Investoren
Du bist Teil unseres erstklassigen Marketing-Teams, trägst Verantwortung und hast viel Handlungsspielraum
Unsere flachen Hierarchien ermöglichen es uns, agil zu bleiben und schnelle Entscheidungen zu treffen
Wir lieben es, live & in Farbe im Büro zusammenzuarbeiten und setzen auf ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (mind. 3 Tage Büro) mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, um Dich bei Deinem fachlichen und persönlichen Wachstum zu fördern, einschließlich eines Weiterbildungsbudgets
Tolle Teamevents wie Sommer- oder Halloween-Partys, Get-Togethers im Büro und After-Work-Drinks
Bleibe aktiv: Profitiere vom JobRad und einer vergünstigten EGYM Wellpass Mitgliedschaft
Satte Freibeträge gibt’s auf unsere JUNIQE Produkte und attraktive Angebote bei unseren Partnern
Kaffee, Freigetränke, Snacks und Feierabendbier


Neugierig? Dann raus aus dem 0815 Alltag und werde Teil von JUNIQE!

Über uns

Wir sind JUNIQE. Erfahre mehr unter juniqe.de.
Show more

Title: Principal Data Analyst
Description:
About Fit Analytics Innovation




Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry, based in Berlin and Chicago. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing accurate sizing and fit recommendations, ultimately reducing returns and enhancing customer satisfaction.




As a trusted partner for e-commerce platforms and retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to revolutionizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.




Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.




Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.







Role Overview:




Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Principal Product Analyst from our Berlin office, where you'll play a critical leadership role in driving the success of our cutting-edge sizing and fit recommendation solutions.




As a seasoned professional, you will drive strategic decision-making and execution while providing mentorship and thought leadership across the organization. You will lead complex data-driven initiatives, optimize client implementation and performance, and spearhead the ideation and development of advanced insights tools.




Additionally, you will own the vision and delivery of our data science products ensuring alignment with broader business objectives. Your responsibilities will encompass everything from creating and executing A/B test programs to driving performance upgrade projects and driving reporting processes and automation, all while providing invaluable insights that contribute to improving and optimizing every stage of our product development and delivery process.







Key Responsibilities:




Showcase and exemplify to team members a high level of expertise in conducting investigative tasks, providing hands-on support to help clients understand performance and areas for improvement through effective data storytelling. Utilize analytical skills to delve deep into data, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of client needs and challenges.




Proactively generate actionable insights aimed at improving our performance, processes and product features. Employ a data-driven mindset to identify opportunities for continuous optimization and innovation.




Lead the inception and implementation of A/B test programs, demonstrating a clear Return on Investment (ROI), and aligning initiatives with our overarching product vision in close collaboration with our data science and product teams.




Lead tooling and reporting automation initiatives to streamline and enhance accurate, data-centric decision-making in order to ensure a seamless alignment with business objectives.







Requirements and Qualifications:




7-12 years of experience in a product analytics or related role.




Expert proficient in SQL and python.




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to generate actionable business strategies.




Proven expertise in A/B testing, data analysis, and experimental design.




Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to convey complex analytical findings effectively to diverse stakeholders.




Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and a deep understanding of data science concepts.




Demonstrated ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement in product analytics processes.




Prior experience in designing and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes is a strong plus.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Über uns - Education Partners

Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners!

Bist du leidenschaftlich daran interessiert, digitale Erlebnisse zu schaffen, die wirklich etwas bewirken?

Wir bei Education Partners sind ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung und gestalten das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.

Deine Aufgaben

Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.


Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.


Dein Profil


Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.


Nice-to-Have:


Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.


Warum wir?


Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt
Show more
HTML:
Über uns - Education Partners

Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners!

Bist du leidenschaftlich daran interessiert, digitale Erlebnisse zu schaffen, die wirklich etwas bewirken?

Wir bei Education Partners sind ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung und gestalten das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.

Deine Aufgaben

Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.

  • Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
  • Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
  • Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
  • Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
  • Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
  • Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.

Dein Profil

  • Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
  • Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
  • Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
  • Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
  • Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
  • Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
  • Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
  • Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
  • Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.

Warum wir?

  • Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
  • Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
  • Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
  • Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
  • Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
Company Description

Vialto Partners is a market leader in global mobility services. Our purpose is to ‘Connect the world’. We are unique and the only stand-alone global mobility business. This presents a rare opportunity for our clients, stakeholders and colleagues.

Our teams help companies streamline and effectively manage their global mobility programs in a cost-efficient and compliant manner. Our services focus on providing cross-border compliance and risk assessment for tax, immigration, business travel, rewards and compensation, and remote work.

Working at Vialto Partners is about getting the chance to be part of a global and dynamic team. Globally, Vialto Partners has over 6,500 staff worldwide and continues to grow. You will work with clients from a range of industries and different geographical locations. We believe in connecting the world and supporting our colleagues to do the same in their careers by undertaking assignments and opportunities globally that broaden their skills and ultimately benefit our clients.

Vialto is unstoppable when we work together in a culture of belonging, where everyone can thrive. We encourage employees to bring their true selves and share their unique talents and expertise to positively impact the communities we serve.

To learn more about what we do, tune in to our podcast On the Move to hear expert insights on issues affecting global mobility, and read about the latest news in the industry. You can also follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram .

Job Description Summary

The Global Office of Transformation at Vialto Partners has the mission to continuously optimize our delivery model and business processes, leveraging our people, technology and scale as a global enterprise. We are obsessed with driving value for our clients, assignees and employees.

Your pivotal role revolves around applying your expertise in data interpretation & manipulation to transform complex datasets into actionable insights. You will take the lead in automating routine tasks, deploying scalable tools across the organization, and enabling the organization to make faster, more informed decisions, all while driving growth and innovation.

Job Description

Data Analysis


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights for business decisions in the form of dashboards & business intelligence products
Utilize statistical tools and software to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven strategies
Assist in optimizing business operations through data analysis
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across reports and analyses
Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in data analytics


Self-service Automation


Design, develop, and maintain self-service automation solutions that allow users to independently manage tasks and access data with minimal manual intervention
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify automation opportunities that improve user experience and operational workflows
Create user-friendly interfaces for automation tools, ensuring accessibility and ease of use for non-technical users
Implement automation solutions that integrate with various applications
Monitor and troubleshoot the performance of self-service automation tools, ensuring high availability and minimal disruptions
Develop training materials & documentation to empower users to take full advantage of self-service tools
Continuously analyze automation processes and feedback to improve functionality and user satisfaction
Stay updated with the latest automation technologies and best practices to continuously enhance service offerings


Change Management & Collaboration


Lead change management initiatives for the rollout of self-service automation tools and new data analytics capabilities, ensuring smooth transitions and adoption across teams
Collaborate closely with the Technology function and stakeholders in Client Service teams to align automation efforts with organizational goals and ensure tools meet business needs
Support ongoing communication and training efforts to encourage self-service adoption and guide users through any process changes


Qualifications & Skills


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
>5 years of proven experience in transforming operational and client-facing processes through data manipulation and insights
>5 years of proven experience in developing and implementing automation solutions, particularly self-service tools
Strong understanding of automation platforms and scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Power Automate or similar)
Highly proficient with tools such as Power BI, Power Apps, and Google Apps Script or Web Apps. Certification in these areas would be preferable
Knowledge of data-wrangling tools e.g. Alteryx is useful but not a must-have
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to build effective solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users
Experience working with cross-functional teams to drive automation projects and improve workflows


Additional Information


We are an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate based on any legally protected status.


Please note, AI is used as part of the application process.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Data Analyst (d/f/m) in Customer Service
Description:
mobile.de is Germany's largest vehicle marketplace with about 1.4 million listed cars, trucks, and motorcycles. Both private customers and more than 40,000 registered vehicle dealers use the platform. Including listing exports to the sister platform Kleinanzeigen, mobile.de reaches about 20 million unique users per month (AGMA digital facts; mobile.de and Kleinanzeigen; categories: cars, motorcycles, commercial vehicles, motorhomes; Ø month April 2022 to March 2023). As a "one-stop shop," mobile.de offers not only buying and selling services but also financing and leasing solutions, among others. The company, founded in 1996, is a subsidiary of Adevinta, a globally leading provider of online classifieds portals.

mobile.de is part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist and sustainability leader with 25+ products in 10 countries.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

Join Us: Shape the Future of Customer Experience with Data! Be Our Data Hero!

Are you driven by the power of data to transform customer experiences? Do you crave a role where your insights directly fuel our success? We're looking for a passionate CS Data Analyst to join our team in Berlin and help us redefine customer service.

Join our dynamic Customer Service team at mobile.de. You'll be an important player amongst 16 internal colleagues and collaborate with 100+ external partners, reporting to our Manager of External Customer Service.

What You'll Achieve With Us


Unlock Customer Secrets: Dive deep into user behavior and reveal the hidden patterns that drive satisfaction.
Fuel Our Growth: Turn your data discoveries into actionable strategies that optimize our operations and elevate customer happiness.
Innovate & Inspire: Collaborate with our team to build cutting-edge dashboards and reporting tools that empower data-driven decisions.
Make a Real Impact: Directly influence our KPIs and see your recommendations translate into tangible improvements.
Be a Key Player: Partner with stakeholders across the company to ensure data accuracy and consistency, becoming a trusted advisor.


You'll Thrive Here If You


Are excited to contribute to a team that values data-driven innovation.
Have 3+ years of experience in an analyst role, and are ready to bring your skills to a dynamic customer service environment.
Possess a strong command of business intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.) and data querying languages (SQL, Python, R).
Understand the critical importance of customer service metrics (CSAT, NPS, etc.) and how they impact our success.
Are fluent in English and have good German skills, enabling seamless collaboration with our diverse team.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field, and are eager to apply your knowledge in a real-world setting.
Are ready to translate complex data into clear, actionable strategies that propel our team forward.


Why Join Us? We're not just looking for an analyst – we're looking for someone to join our mission. You'll be part of a team that's passionate about delivering exceptional customer experiences, and you'll have the opportunity to make a real difference. If you're ready to use your data skills to shape the future of customer service, we want to hear from you!

Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary 💸
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) 🏆
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.
Show more
