  • Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
  • A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
  • Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱

On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.




We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)

Join our team at our location in Berlin, Verl, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Stockholm – flexible working conditions available.




Key Responsibilities:

Explore large datasets, evaluate the data quality and model data
Apply statistical methods to understand consumer behavioral patterns relevant for product development and operational efficiency
Analyze problems to understand their root cause
Work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to build and implement analytical solutions
Collaborate on data-related projects
Visualize data and turn data into stories
Derive actionable insights, provide decision support, and make recommendations based on data-driven insights
Consult business units and functional units, such as product or commercial teams in data related questions
Drive, manage and lead data related projects while fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.




Your Profile:

5+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis roles within Data & Analytics solutions
Master/MBA degree in numerate subject (e.g. Data Science, Mathematics, Informatics, Economics, Natural Science or Engineering)
Proficient in a programming language such as SQL, Python or R
Experience in cluster analysis, machine learning
Understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation
Advanced in collecting, organizing, analysing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to identify issues, structure and conduct necessary analysis, and draw well-informed conclusions
Consulting skills, especially strong ability to provide insights and recommendations
Extraordinary communication skills to effectively convey complex information and collaborate with diverse teams
Ability to balance multiple priorities, be detail-oriented, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Excellent Team player




Nice if you have:

Experience within the payments, risk, debt collection or factoring space
Experience with modern data stacks, preferably Databricks
Experience in quantitative research

#EUR33




Benefits:

At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als “Data Analyst” (m/w/d)




Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.




Was wir bieten:

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt.




Dein Impact:

Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities


Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.


How You Will Contribute


Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value


By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile


5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.


We as a Team

We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.

Our offer


100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!


Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application <3

About Us

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N°1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Ready to join us?
Show more

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We’re proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 – but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide




Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon







Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Pricing
Description:
DocMorris steht für kundenorientierte innovative Dienstleistungen und eine große Produktvielfalt rund um die digitale Gesundheitsversorgung. Sie reichen von der schnellen Terminvereinbarung für den Online-Arztbesuch auf der Telemedizin-Plattform von TeleClinic bis zur pharmazeutischen Beratung und Versorgung mit verschreibungspflichtigen und rezeptfreien Medikamenten sowie Gesundheitsprodukten aus Deutschlands bekanntester Online-Apotheke.
Hinzu kommt der Marktplatz mit einem breiten ergänzenden Sortiment von Heil- und Hilfsmitteln sowie Produkten aus den Bereichen Ernährung, Beauty und Familie. Damit schafft DocMorris für ihre Kundinnen und Kunden einen einfachen Zugang zu umfassenden Gesundheitsdienstleistungen an einem Ort mit nur einem Klick. Im Segment Deutschland erwirtschaftete die Schweizer DocMorris AG im Jahr 2023 mit über 9 Millionen aktiven Kundinnen und Kunden einen Außenumsatz von 976 Millionen CHF.


Aufgaben



Du entwickelst Reportings und erstellst Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Umsatz-, Margen- und Preisentwicklung sowie zum Erfolg unserer Promotions.


Auf dieser Basis erarbeitest Du Handlungsempfehlungen für strategische und taktische Pricing-Entscheidungen. Damit trägst Du maßgeblich zum Geschäftserfolg unserer Produkte im Bereich der freiverkäuflichen Arzneimittel bei.


Du entwickelst unsere Pricing-Prozesse weiter und wirkst mit bei der Optimierung unserer Pricing-Algorithmen. Dabei wendest Du auch komplexe Analysemethoden an.


Du arbeitest eng mit den Bereichen Online-Marketing, Category Management, Supply-Chain-Management und Einkauf sowie unserem Data-Team zusammen.



Qualifikation



Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre.


Ein kommerzielles Verständnis im Bereich E-Commerce, idealerweise im Bereich Pricing, rundet Dein Profil ab.


Du hast Kenntnisse im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken, hast bereits mit SQL gearbeitet und besitzt Erfahrungen mit BI- und Visualisierungstools (z.B. Tableau, Power BI, QlikView oder anderen).


Idealerweise hast Du bereits statistische Analysemethoden angewendet und mit gängigen Statistiksoftwarepaketen gearbeitet.


Du hast ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten.


Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.



Benefits



Attraktive Vergünstigungen in diversen Shops über Corporate Benefits


Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit attraktiven Arbeitgeberzuschüssen


30 Urlaubstage


Möglichkeit zur Teilnahme am Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktienoptionen)


Zugang zu eLearning-Plattformen wie LinkedIn Learning


Fairer Lohn für Festangestellte und Zeitarbeitnehmer sowie angemessene Vergütung von Praktika


Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßige Entwicklungsgespräche


Tolle Mitarbeiter-Events und jährliche Firmenfeiern


Wohlfühl-Arbeitsumgebung mit klimatisierten, hellen Büros. Ergonomisch eingerichtete Arbeitsplätze mit hochmoderner technischer Ausstattung.


Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten


Gute Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr





Gestalte mit uns das neue Gesund! Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung!




Bei Fragen steht Dir Matthias Wegerle unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0)621 397316 654 gerne zur Verfügung.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst in Bioinformatics and Ecology (f/m/x)
Description:
The Department of Evolutionary and Integrative Ecology at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB, www.igb-berlin.de) invites applications for a Data Analyst focusing on genomic and ecological data. The position will be located in Berlin-Dahlem. It will also include managing and analysing large datasets and supporting IGB’s Competence and Technology Platform on Research Data Management.

Your role


Process and analyse genomic and molecular data from environmental samples and non-model organisms
Manage and analyse experimental and field data
Write data management plans and support researchers in the department to implement these plans following best practices
Support IGB research teams as a member of the IGB Research Data Management group
Apply and support the development of data visualisation tools


Your profile


University degree in bioinformatics, computational ecology, statistics, computer science, data science, or equivalent expertise, including from the private sector
Competence in R and one or more additional programming languages (e.g. Python, C++, C#)
Experience in data mining, scholarly databases, and the management, curation and analysis of data following FAIR data principles and Open Science practices
Very good English communication skills; German skills desirable
Excellent social skills, service orientation and ability to work in an international and diverse team
Prior knowledge of freshwater science is advantageous


Our offer

We offer an international and dynamic work environment located in our new Joint Biodiversity Building in Berlin-Dahlem. You will become part of a motivated team that encourages active participation and new ideas. We promote your professional development through qualifications and further training opportunities, and we actively support the compatibility of family and career.

This is a full-time position, but it is also suitable for part-time work. You will be paid according to the collective agreement for the public sector (TVöD Bund) and benefit from flexible working hours, a 39-hour work week, 30 days of vacation, a company pension scheme, and a subsidy for public transportation. The contract is initially limited to two years with the option of permanent employment. The salary class will be based on qualifications and assigned duties.

Given our commitment to diversity, we welcome all applications, regardless of gender and gender identity, origin, nationality, religion, belief, health and physical disabilities, age or sexual orientation. IGB is committed to increasing the number of women in this field, therefore applications from women are particularly welcome. Various measures are in place at IGB to support gender equality. We support the reconciliation of work and family life. Applicants with a disability will be given preference if they are equally qualified.

Are you interested?

Then apply by 06.04.2025 by submitting your documents (up to 2-page cover letter, CV, certificates/references, brief overview of your past projects) and stating the reference number 06/2025 exclusively via our recruitment platform at www.igb-berlin.de/en/jobs. Any questions can be directed to Jonathan Jeschke (Jonathan.Jeschke@igb-berlin.de).

"Research for the future of our freshwaters" is the mission of IGB – Germany’s largest and one of the leading international centres for freshwater research. In order to investigate different aspects of freshwater ecosystems, their biota and societal relevance, we unite a wide range of disciplines and understand research as a joint effort. With more than 350 employees and guests from all over the world, we conduct research at five locations in Berlin and at Lake Stechlin (Brandenburg). IGB is a member of the German Leibniz Association and the Forschungsverbund Berlin e. V. www.igb-berlin.de
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data based at our HQ in Berlin - Schöneberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years’ experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You’ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe’s automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: BI-Consultant (m/w/d) - Remote oder Berlin
Description:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.




Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.




Was wir Dir bieten:




Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.




Was Du mitbringst:




Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.




Interesse?




Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Show more
HTML:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.


Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.


Was wir Dir bieten:


Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

  • Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
  • Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
  • Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
  • Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
  • Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
  • Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
  • Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
  • Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.


Was Du mitbringst:


  • Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
  • Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
  • Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
  • Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
  • Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
  • Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
  • Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
  • Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
  • Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
  • Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
  • Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.


Interesse?


Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Size & Fit (all genders)
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst for Size & Fit , you will play a key role in addressing the challenge of finding the right fit in online shopping.

Size and Fit works towards solving the customer problem of not being able to find the right fit in online shopping. Our mission involves gaining a deep understanding of customers’ preferences related to size and fit, as well as a comprehensive knowledge of the assortment attributes and measurements from our brands. The real magic happens when we successfully match both.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Size and Fit team, which includes members from Product Management, Analytics, Applied Science, and Engineering. You will act as a bridge to the commercial team. You will measure and analyze how the solutions we provide to our customers are impacting our business and your insights will enable strategic commercial decisions at Zalando.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Bring the business data-driven analytical approach to the Size & Fit Team; you generate hypotheses and try to test them by performing descriptive, exploratory and quantitative analyses. You can translate data into actionable insights for the business. You know when a hypothesis can only be tested by an experiment, and you can help create and drive them.
You are the connector between the Product and the Business. You can translate the Size and Fit benefits to answer complex business questions and identify and measure commercial opportunities.
Be a reliable partner for the Size & Fit Team when related to commercial reporting and analytics, and support the Team with more complex analysis.
Avoid working in silos by collaborating with cross-functional leaders from Applied Science, Product, Content and Customer Analytics to drive innovation. You incorporate data from different sources within and outside of Zalando to drive projects.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




Proven track record of 5+ experience in analytics A university degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Quantitative social science, or a comparable subject.
Strong technical background with advanced SQL skills and programming background (e.g. Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks). Excellent knowledge in coding for data retrieval, exploration and analysis. Advanced statistical skills such as A/B testing and causal inference. Constant drive and tenacity to learn new techniques and tools are a must.
Understanding of the economics of online platforms and/or online fashion retailers, as well as the commercial KPIs governing their success.
Effective communication to convince any audience with the insights you generate and compelling storytelling in any form that enables decision-making.
Enjoy working cross-functionally; you have great stakeholder management skills to work with different levels of management to support, challenge and bring solutions.
Hands-on mentality, a person who always finds solutions to challenges. You are proactive, can adapt quickly to changes and always remain focused on our quality objectives.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits; here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counselling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching are available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst - Marketing (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, Madrid, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

In this pivotal role, you'll spearhead our marketing strategies, aligning them seamlessly with sales objectives to propel business success. As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be the cornerstone of our Go-to-market department, leveraging your expertise in analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic planning to ignite innovative marketing initiatives and foster robust collaboration with our Sales team.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Marketing Planning: You'll lead data-driven strategies within our Go-to-market framework, ensuring they resonate with our sales targets and organizational objectives.
Marketing Campaign Analysis: You're responsible for assessing campaign performance, optimizing for maximum ROI across various channels and regions.
Customer Segmentation and Personalization: You will execute advanced segmentation and collaborate with the GTM team for targeted marketing, boosting lead conversion and retention.
Trend Identification and Forecasting: Your role involves analyzing market trends, predicting future shifts, and offering competitive insights.
Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will mentor analysts and ensure cross-departmental cohesion, particularly with Sales and CX teams.
Report Generation and Presentation: You're tasked with creating and presenting reports that drive continuous improvement.
Budget Management: You oversee marketing KPI adjustments within our bi-annual budget review, ensuring alignment with financial and marketing goals.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: 4+ years in marketing analytics, with a leadership background.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical models for business problem analysis.
Platform Familiarity: Skilled in Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo, Dreamdata, and Snowflake.
Data-Driven Leadership: Experience in fostering a data-centric culture and making data-based decisions.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve into data, identifying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to simplify complex data insights for diverse stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Approach: Proactive problem-solving, focusing on impactful results and leveraging data insights for tangible improvements.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.
Show more

Title: (Senior) Business Intelligence | Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Bei Superchat gestalten wir die Kommunikation zwischen Unternehmen und ihren Kund*innen neu. Unsere Mission ist klar: Die Kommunikation mit einem Unternehmen sollte so einfach und natürlich sein wie ein Gespräch mit deinen Freunden.




Superchat ist aktuell stark am Wachsen und damit stehen viele spannende Themen an. Wir suchen dich als Unterstützung! 🚀


So könnte dein Tag aussehen:



Du baust unsere erste BI-Infrastruktur und Reporting-Systeme auf, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen und unser Wachstum zu unterstützen


Du erstellst Datenpipelines und Modelle, die Daten effizient strukturieren und als Grundlage für Analysen und Berichte dienen


Du analysierst große Datensätze, übersetzt sie in klare Insights und unterstützt damit wichtige Entscheidungen


Du arbeitest eng mit Stakeholdern zusammen, um Lösungen zu entwickeln und Fragen wie Marketing-Performance und ROI zu beantworten


Du führst Experimente durch, analysierst die Ergebnisse und entwickelst daraus Wachstumsstrategien für Sales und Marketing



Das bringst du mit:



Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Bereich Analytics oder BI, idealerweise mit Fokus auf Sales und Marketing in der B2B-SaaS-Branche


Du kennst dich mit der Verwaltung von Datenbanken und der Analyse großer und komplexer Datensätze aus


Du beherrschst Visualisierungstools wie Looker und Tableau und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich darstellen


Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL, sowohl bei Abfragen als auch bei der Datenmanipulation


Du hast Erfahrung mit dem Aufbau von Datenpipelines und Datenmodellen, um Daten effizient zu strukturieren


Du bist fließend in Deutsch und Englisch bei Wort und Schrift



Deine Benefits:



Du genießt eine attraktive Vergütung


Du nutzt ein jährliches Budget für deine persönliche Weiterbildung, das für Konferenzen, Kurse, Bücher oder einen Karrierecoach verwendet werden kann


Du wählst zwischen einer Urban Sports Club/John Reed Mitgliedschaft oder einem Fahrkarten-Abo


Du profitierst von einem starken Onboarding-Programm sowie regelmäßigen Coachings und Feedback, die deine professionelle Entwicklung fördern


Du erlebst eine integrative Start-up-Kultur mit starkem Team Spirit und nimmst an regelmäßigen Team Events teil, bei denen wir unsere Ideen teilen und Erfolge feiern





Das sind wir:




Superchat wurde 2020 in Berlin von Yilmaz und Mika gegründet. Mit schon über 5.000 Unternehmenskunden sind wir auf starkem Wachstumskurs. Mit einer Series A-Finanzierung von 15,6 Mio. US-Dollar werden wir unter anderem von den führenden Investoren Blossom Capital und 468 Capital unterstützt.




Wir bieten eine umfassende Messaging-Suite für Unternehmen, die alle Kommunikationskanäle (WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook und viele mehr) in einer Plattform vereint. Das ermöglicht unseren Kunden, auf einfache Art und Weise Newsletter zu versenden, Kundenbeziehungen aufzubauen und Produkte und Dienstleistungen zu verkaufen.


Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass Diversität Unternehmen besser macht. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerber:innen. Unabhängig von Gender, Herkunft, Nationalität oder Glaube. Fühl dich frei und schicke uns gerne deine Bewerbung!


Mit deiner Bewerbung stimmst du unseren Datenschutzrichtlinien zu.




Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This Organic Growth Analytics team works with marketeers, analysts, product managers, data scientists and engineers to create and promote a best-in-class marketplace product. You will also collaborate closely with the Marketing Analytics team that focuses on paid acquisition channels to create an aligned holistic view. Your team will build an understanding of how to utilise our organic growth channels to the maximum capacity, and support the teams to reach their targets via operational and strategic insights, identifying opportunities and enabling proper measurement.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and marketing decisions.
In collaboration with stakeholders identify organic growth opportunities and dependencies.
Collaborate with marketing analytics and Growth cluster leads to develop a comprehensive understanding of user acquisition and retention channels.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Managers and Marketing Leads.


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
Strong statistical background and proficiency with advanced statistical methods
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers, and translate them into actionable insights
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction in ambiguous situations and with highly engaged individuals
Strong customer-centric mindset with a focus on business impact
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Experience in SEO and CRM analytics, and with growth data products is of significant benefit.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.

Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development

About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This Organic Growth Analytics team works with marketeers, analysts, product managers, data scientists and engineers to create and promote a best-in-class marketplace product. You will also collaborate closely with the Marketing Analytics team that focuses on paid acquisition channels to create an aligned holistic view. Your team will build an understanding of how to utilise our organic growth channels to the maximum capacity, and support the teams to reach their targets via operational and strategic insights, identifying opportunities and enabling proper measurement.

You Will

  • Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and marketing decisions.
  • In collaboration with stakeholders identify organic growth opportunities and dependencies.
  • Collaborate with marketing analytics and Growth cluster leads to develop a comprehensive understanding of user acquisition and retention channels.
  • Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams strategy and success.
  • Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
  • Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven development and evaluation.
  • Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
  • Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Managers and Marketing Leads.

Who You Are

  • 5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
  • Excellent stakeholder management
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
  • Strong statistical background and proficiency with advanced statistical methods
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
  • Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers, and translate them into actionable insights
  • Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction in ambiguous situations and with highly engaged individuals
  • Strong customer-centric mindset with a focus on business impact
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice To Have

  • Experience in SEO and CRM analytics, and with growth data products is of significant benefit.
  • Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
  • Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
  • Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
  • A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
  • Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
  • English-speaking office environment
  • Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
  • Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
  • Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
  • GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
  • Relocation assistance if needed

And more...

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Product Analytics (m/w/d)
Description:
FIXING THE PLANET BY MAKING HOMES CARBON-FREE!


With €35 million in funding from top-tier investors such as COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global, we are working towards a future where climate-neutral buildings - simply & rapidly - become a reality. At Enter, we aggregate and analyze relevant building data so that homeowners can sustainably reduce their energy costs and increase the value of their property.




We believe in:





Common code access


No gatekeepers


Simplicity over industry standards


Embracing the small change


Each API is a product


Baked in quality





We’re looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.


Deine Aufgaben



Create and maintain the product analytics dashboards and related KPIs, ensuring alignment with contract compliance and minimizing incidents.


Manage the lifecycle of all data products in our visualization tool Metabase, including decommissioning unused dashboards, aiming for less than 5% unused dashboards weekly.


Increase the weekly usage of Metabase to 80% within your crew.


Ensure the Metabase structure is organized and easy to navigate.


Take responsibility for the correctness of data, regardless of the origin of any issues.


Be a key resource for team members to improve their ability to read and interpret data effectively.



Dein Profil



You have extensive experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, maintaining dashboards and KPIs (5+ years of experience)


You have advanced proficiency in managing data products in Metabase or similar platforms.


Experience with Product Analytic tools like Amplitude and Event based reportings is a plus.


You have a strong understanding of data lifecycle management, including cleaning up and decommissioning unused assets.


You have analytical skills and pay attention to detail, with a focus on data accuracy and quality.


You have excellent communication and collaboration skills to support crew leads and team members in understanding and using data.


You have the ability to combine technical data expertise with domain-specific knowledge.


You are fluent in English (German is a plus, but not required).



Benefits



Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.


Attractive & competitive compensation.


Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.


Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.


Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.


Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.
Show more

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.




Qualification Path:




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Germany for the last 2 Years consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Germany
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Market Intelligence Specialist (m/f/d)
Description:
Requisition Number: 64998

Corning is vital to progress – in the industries we help shape and in the world we share.

We invent life-changing technologies using materials science. Our scientific and manufacturing expertise, boundless curiosity, and commitment to purposeful invention place us at the center of the way the world interacts, works, learns, and lives.

Our sustained investment in research, development, and invention means we’re always ready to solve the toughest challenges alongside our customers.

Our Optical Communications segment has recently evolved from being a manufacturer of optical fiber and cable, hardware and equipment to being a comprehensive provider of industry-leading optical solutions across the broader communications industry.This segment is classified into two main product groupings – carrier network and enterprise network. The carrier network product group consists primarily of products and solutions for optical-based communications infrastructure for services such as video, data and voice communications. The enterprise network product group consists primarily of optical-based communication networks sold to businesses, governments and individuals for their own use.

For our Berlin Headquarter (or Strykow, Poland) we are currently looking for a

Market Intelligence Specialist (m/f/d)

Responsibilities


Analyze news quickly to uncover and disseminate meaningful insights on market landscape.
Analyze the impact of new market and competitive developments affecting Corning.
Support the EMEA MI OCS Lead in ad-hoc MI projects.
Support maintenance of MI knowledge sharing platform and mobile app. Structure, organize and maintain MI content architecture to maximize customer experience and utility. Scope covers training, marketing campaigns, leveraging usage analytics, troubleshooting, driving collaborative platform to build and exchange rich MI insights.
Strengthen linkages between the MI Team and COC’s Commercial and Business Intelligence Teams to enhance MI collaboration.
Maintain and disseminate competitor one-pagers. Collaborate with COC and MI team to chronicle key events and articulate business implications.
Monitor intelligence sources (e.g. competitors’ web sites) and assist OCS Strategy Team in compiling daily and weekly English-language market intelligence communications.
Measure usage of these market intelligence communications with quantitative statistics; use to drive continuous improvement.
Conduct secondary market research to gather relevant information from a variety of sources and integrate into competitive and market intelligence projects.
Support administrative tasks related to MI newsletters platform (create new MI newsletters, maintain search taxonomy, resolve technical issues); collaborate with external MI software provider; maintain MI Share Point and Box sites/content; maintain MI Team’s e-mail box, distribution lists, etc.
Conduct comparative analysis for competitors vs. Corning EMEA (e.g. manufacturing costs, product costs, financial analysis).


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Finance or relevant field required. Master’s degree in Business Intelligence or Business Administration preferred.
Previous relevant job experience in Market Research, Competitive + Market Intelligence and/or Data Analytics.
Minimum 2-3 years of work experience, preferably in the telecom industry.
Strong knowledge of Market Intelligence related processes.
Good understanding of Corning Optical Communications product portfolio, target markets as well as our competitors and customers' landscape.
Fluent in English, written and spoken. Polish language skills are a benefit.
Structured and analytical thinker with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Sound understanding of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.
Quick learner; persistent, takes initiative, determined, resilient.
Experience with Power BI and AI desired.


Workplaces


Berlin, Germany or Strykow, Poland. Hybrid working conditions (2 days per week at home and 3 days in the office).


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. To request an accommodation, please contact us at accommodations@corning.com .

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Revenue Intelligence)
Description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

Identify and escalate negative and positive trends in main customer and category KPIs to boost the company’s growth and profitability.

Responsibilities


Conduct in-depth economic analyses on current trading performance, market research, demand forecasting, pricing strategies, and competitor analysis.
Develop and maintain economic models to predict key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, revenue, and customer behavior and monitor those against actual performance outcomes.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
Conduct and analyze A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of different marketing and pricing strategies.
Prepare clear and concise reports to communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions and drive business growth.



Job Requirements


Master's degree in Economics, Business and/or Finance, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field.
2-5 years of experience in economic analysis or FP&A, preferably within the e-commerce, retail or technology industry.
Proficiency in SQL.
Proficiency in statistical software such as Python, R or Stata.
Basic knowledge of causal inference methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and independently.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Fluent English.



What do we offer?


Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program – providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work



Join us today and let’s create a success story together!
Show more
