  • Develop and maintain economic models to predict key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, revenue, and customer behavior and monitor those against actual performance outcomes.
  • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
  • Conduct and analyze A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of different marketing and pricing strategies.
  • Prepare clear and concise reports to communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions and drive business growth.


Job Requirements

  • Master's degree in Economics, Business and/or Finance, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field.
  • 2-5 years of experience in economic analysis or FP&A, preferably within the e-commerce, retail or technology industry.
  • Proficiency in SQL.
  • Proficiency in statistical software such as Python, R or Stata.
  • Basic knowledge of causal inference methods.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and independently.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
  • Fluent English.


What do we offer?

  • Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
  • Fast growing international company with stable employment
  • Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
  • Mental Wellbeing Program – providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
  • Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
  • Free English and German language classes
  • Referral Program with attractive incentives
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid work


Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Title: Online Data Analyst (m,f,d) - Germany
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? Enjoy the freedom to work at your own pace, from anywhere in Germany you feel comfortable.




What you'll do:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Why Join Us?

Flexible, part-time hours — work when it suits you.
Be part of a global AI community with 1 million+ contributors.
Opportunity to work on projects for top global brands.
Mental health support and access to well-being tools.




Basic Requirements

Residing in Germany for at least two consecutive years and demonstrating full professional proficiency in both German and English.
A comprehensive understanding of contemporary and historical events in business, media, sports, news, social media, and cultural affairs within Germany.
Skilled in adhering to guidelines and conducting online research using search engines, digital maps, and various website resources.
Capable of managing a diverse range of tasks, including those related to maps, news, audio analysis, and relevance assessment.
Access to a high-speed broadband internet connection, a personal computer, and the necessary software tools.




To join the program, you'll take an open-book qualification exam to assess your suitability and complete ID verification. Our team will provide guidelines and learning materials before the exam, which you can complete at your convenience within a set timeframe. This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.




Payment Information:

The rate of pay per task includes the time required to read the task guidelines. Payment will be issued in accordance with the terms outlined in the contributor agreement, upon successful completion of the tasks.




Ready to earn extra while contributing to the advancement of technology?




To get started, simply click "Apply Now." Make sure your device location is set to Germany for location validation. Then, create an account and complete the required fields. Set German as your primary language and English as your secondary language. Upload your CV in English (PDF format preferred)

Title: Staff Product Analyst, DATA (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Staff Product Analyst you are an all-rounder who thrives equally working on technical topics as well as value-delivery through insights, presentation and data visualisation. Indeed, your extensive experience and knowledge across technical and business related topics enables you to go “end to end” with a high level of quality and scalability as well as driving best practices within the Product Analytics community. Not limited to one squad or domain, your impact is across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying common needs and pain points across the teams and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practice across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


#data

What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here.

JR102527

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero’s profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how we should prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor Management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, Digital Sales, Sales Enablement)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient using orchestration tools (preferably DBT + Airflow)
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Proficient in at least one Visualisation tool (preferably Tableau)
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Ability to correctly present findings to senior stakeholders
Critical thinking and Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analysis Expert
Description:
The CTAO Central Organisation is seeking a Data Analysis Expert to support the Project Science Office at the SDMC Centre in Zeuthen.




Your tasks:

Run the CTAO reconstruction software on observational data and simulations, producing science data products at all levels from DL0 to DL3 (i.e., data levels ranging from raw to science-ready data products).
Test and evaluate different reconstruction algorithms.
Optimise reconstruction parameters for observation conditions, array layout and study requirements.
Provide feedback to pipeline developers and suggest enhancements based on analysis results and operational needs.
Support telescope acceptance, array commissioning and science verification activities, providing performance estimates and preparing accompanying reports.
Contribute to studies such as estimating the uncertainty budget, planning a telescope’s deployment strategy, array enhancements and upgrades, etc.
Develop and run regular benchmark tests.
Contribute to the data product verification process (data quality control) for data levels from DL0 to DL3.
Present analysis results and performance estimates to CTAO management and in scientific conferences.
Other duties as assigned by the Simulation Coordinator.




Your qualifications, experience and skills:

Degree in physics, astronomy, computer science or related discipline.
Prior experience and solid understanding of reconstruction and analysis techniques of imaging atmospheric Cherenkov telescopes is highly desirable.
Strong proficiency in Python.
Familiarity with software development workflows (e.g., version control systems like Git, CI/CD pipelines).
Familiarity with grid computing would be an asset.
Proficiency in creating clear and informative data visualizations to support analysis and communicate results effectively.
Able to work both independently and in a team.
Excellent written, organisational and verbal communication skills.
A high level of proficiency in English is essential.




You will be reporting to: Simulation Coordinator




Your duty station: Zeuthen, Germany. Ability and willingness to travel within the EU.




What we offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package, with the salary determined based on the candidate's experience and ability.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Flexible working hours and partial remote work options.




How to apply: Please apply on BambooHR

Applications deadline: 23 March 2025




For this job posting we would like to encourage people that comply with the Italian law 68/99 to send us their applications.




For more information on CTAO please visit www.ctao.org.

For more information on the advertised position please contact, ctao-hr@cta-observatory.org.




Applications are accepted and evaluated without distinction on any grounds of gender, race, colour, ethnic or social origin, genetic features, language, religion or belief, political or any other opinion, membership of a national minority, gender identity, property, birth, disability, age or sexual orientation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
🌈 WE AT FRIENDSURANCE




We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.




✅ YOUR TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES




Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.




🎯 YOU WILL CREATE IMPACT BY




Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value




By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!




👻 YOUR PROFILE




5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.




🫂 WE AS A TEAM




We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.




At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.




🤝 OUR OFFER




100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!




Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application ❤️

Show more

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.


🤝 OUR OFFER


  • 100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
  • Flexible and family-friendly working hours
  • A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
  • A generous personal development budget for all employees
  • Legendary team events and parties
  • Language classes
  • Urban Sports membership subsidy
  • Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
  • A unique and international team
  • A people-focused management
  • And much more!


Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application ❤️

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will help drive measurement, strategy, and tactical decision-making within GetYourGuide. You will solve problems that could range from understanding the relationship between review rating and conversion rate, figuring out how to measure adding videos to our product pages, what is the business value of an account login or developing a way to measure whether our customers’ on trip experience is optimal.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions.
Help the Category Expansion group to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams’ product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Manager.


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to navigate ambiguity.
Strong customer focus with a focus on business impact.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Previous experience managing analysts is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) für das Datentransparenzverfahren
Description:
Sind Sie bereit für Neues und wollen im deutschen Gesundheitswesen mitwirken? Dann unterstützen Sie uns als

Data Analyst (m/w/d) für das Datentransparenzverfahren

Wir, der GKV-Spitzenverband, vertreten die Kranken- und Pflegekassen und damit auch die Interessen der rund 75 Millionen Versicherten und Beitragszahlenden auf Bundesebene gegenüber der Politik und den Leistungserbringenden wie der Ärzte- und Apothekerschaft oder den Krankenhäusern. Als GKV-Spitzenverband übernehmen wir alle nicht-wettbewerblichen Aufgaben in der Kranken- und Pflegeversicherung auf Bundesebene.

Der Stabsbereich Vertragsanalyse unterstützt die Fachabteilungen des GKV Spitzenverbandes mit Datenanalysen. Daneben übernimmt er weitere gesetzliche Aufgaben, wie die Sammlung von Abrechnungsdaten der gesetzlichen Krankenkassen für das Datentransparenzverfahren.

Unsere Benefits Für Sie

Sie erwartet ab sofort ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis in Vollzeit (39 Stunden wöchentlich). Ihr Arbeitsplatz befindet sich in der Mitte Berlins mit hervorragender Anbindung an den öffentlichen Personennahverkehr in einem modern aufgestellten und tarifgebundenen Verband. Wir bieten


flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit des anteiligen mobilen Arbeitens,
eine sehr attraktive Vergütung nach unserem Haustarifvertrag mit 13 Monatsgehältern,
30 Urlaubstage im Kalenderjahr,
eine betriebliche Altersversorgung und die Möglichkeit eines Zeitwertkontos,
einen Zuschuss zu einem Abonnement im öffentlichen Personennahverkehr,
Teilnahme an individuellen Fort- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie
weitere Vorteile, etwa im Rahmen der betrieblichen Gesundheitsförderung.


Sollten Sie Interesse an einer Teilzeittätigkeit haben, sprechen Sie uns gerne darauf an. Der GKV-Spitzenverband bietet flexible Möglichkeiten, die dazu beitragen, Beruf und Privatleben in Einklang zu bringen.

Bewerbungen von schwerbehinderten und gleichgestellten Menschen sind in besonderer Weise willkommen.

Ihr Zukünftiger Aufgabenbereich


Zukünftig sollen Gesundheitsdaten für die Forschung besser verfügbar sein. Die Nutzung ist klar definiert und am Allgemeinwohl ausgerichtet. Das Ziel ist, die Versorgung der Bevölkerung zu verbessern. Sie wirken dabei mit, die hierfür eingerichtete Datensammelstelle beim GKV Spitzenverband nach
303b SGB V weiterzuentwickeln.
Sie analysieren Daten zu Fragen der gesundheitlichen Versorgung und bereiten die Ergebnisse in geeigneter Form adressatengerecht auf.
Sie entwickeln selbstständig Auswertungsroutinen, um die Daten zu plausibilisieren und auf Vollständigkeit zu prüfen.
Sie unterstützen und beraten interdisziplinär die Fachabteilungen des GKV-Spitzenverbandes bei methodischen und datenrelevanten Fragestellungen.
Sie wirken bei dem Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung von Analyse-, Monitoring- und Berichtsroutinen mit.
Sie stimmen sich mit unseren Mitgliedskassen, Verbänden und Dienstleistern ab. Außerdem unterstützen und beraten Sie diese zu Fragen der Datenanalyse.


Was wir von Ihnen erwarten?


Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium, vorzugsweise im Bereich Gesundheits- oder Sozialwissenschaften, Statistik, Ökonomie beziehungsweise über vergleichbare Qualifikationen.
Sie verfügen über fortgeschrittene Erfahrungen mit einer gängigen Statistiksoftware wie SAS oder fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse in R oder Python.
Sie besitzen sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Arbeit mit Datenbanken einschließlich SQL und können Erfahrungen im Umgang mit großen Datenmengen vorweisen.
Kenntnisse im deutschen Gesundheitswesen, insbesondere in den Datenverfahren und Vergütungssystemen in der gesetzlichen Krankenversicherung, sind von Vorteil.
Ein sehr gutes Kommunikationsvermögen in Wort und Schrift in Deutsch mit mindestens Niveau C2, ausgezeichnete analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, Eigeninitiative und Zuverlässigkeit runden Ihr Profil ab.


Wenn wir Ihre Neugier geweckt haben,

bitten wir Sie, Ihre vollständige Bewerbung als PDF-Datei mit maximal 5 MB (Anschreiben, Werdegang, Abschluss- und Arbeitszeugnisse, gegebenenfalls Nachweis über eine Schwerbehinderung) unter Angabe der Ausschreibungsnummer 1145 bis zum 19.03.2025 bei uns einzureichen. Bitte nutzen Sie vorzugsweise das Online-Bewerbungsformular auf unserer Homepage: www.gkv-spitzenverband.de.

Ihre Ansprechperson

Nachfragen richten Sie bitte an Herrn Thomas Staffeldt (Stabsbereichsleiter Vertragsanalyse), Telefonnummer 030 206288-2010.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass beim Versenden der Bewerbungsunterlagen per E-Mail der Inhalt dieser unverschlüsselt ist. Informieren Sie sich über unsere Datenschutzregelungen auf unserer Homepage.

Wir weisen darauf hin, dass unvollständige Bewerbungsunterlagen nicht berücksichtigt werden können.
Show more

Title: Senior BI Analyst
Description:
Why us?

RABOT Energy is looking for a Senior BI Analyst to take our data insights to the next level. With our fast company and consumer growth, the demand for high-quality insights rises across the company., We are looking for an experienced analyst to join our BI team and become a trusted partner for our stakeholders. This role will be key in delivering actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across all departments.

Your Impact


Design and develop BI solutions, dashboards, and reports to provide meaningful insights to business stakeholders.
Play a key role in structuring and defining our Data Warehouse to ensure scalability and data integrity.
Guide and mentor team members and peers, providing technical QA and ensuring best practices in data visualization and reporting.
Analyze complex datasets and translate them into clear, strategic recommendations for leadership and cross-functional teams.
Work closely with different departments to understand data needs, ensuring insights are accessible and impactful for decision-making.


What Can You Bring


Professional Experience: Proven track record in designing and developing BI solutions, dashboards, and reports together with top-tier-stakeholders.
Technical Expertise: Advanced proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Metabase, Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Looker).
SQL Mastery: Strong SQL skills for data extraction, manipulation, and optimization.
Data Warehousing & ETL: Experience working with data warehouses, dbt, ETL processes, and big data technologies.
Analytical Mindset: Ability to analyze large and complex datasets, extract key insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Clear Communication: Ability to present complex data insights in an understandable way to senior management and non-technical teams.
Language Skills: Fluent in English. Knowledge of German is a plus


Lacking experience in some of the areas mentioned? No need for concern – we are committed to providing you with the necessary support for learning, training, and on-the-job coaching

Our Benefits


Enjoy flexible working hours and the freedom to work remotely 2 days a week, offering you a work-life balance that suits your lifestyle.
We're committed to your growth. Benefit from comprehensive training, regular team meetings, and open, transparent communication to keep you informed and engaged.
Maintain your physical well-being with an Urban Sports Club membership that offers you a world of fitness opportunities.
Immerse yourself in a vibrant startup atmosphere, where a spirited team, exciting team events, and our 'Employees Recruit Employees' program await you – your path to rewarding success.
Celebrate the holidays with peace of mind, as you'll always have Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve off to make cherished memories.
28 Vacation days
Workation: Enjoy two weeks of workation per year and work from anywhere in the EU


For all our positions, we are open to providing flexible work arrangements to accommodate the unique needs of each individual.

About Us

RABOT Energy is an independent supplier of 100 % renewable energy, offering dynamic electricity tariffs to private and business customers. By passing on exchange buying prices to our customers, we can save them up to 35 % on their electricity bills. Electric vehicle owners particularly benefit from our dynamic electricity tariff, as we have developed a smart system that signals the car when to automatically charge during periods of low electricity prices. And this is just the beginning!

Our mission is to empower every consumer to efficiently manage their energy consumption costs while safeguarding the environment and natural resources. Through our provision of 100% renewable energy and comprehensive smart charging and energy management solutions for homes, RABOT Energy actively contributes to increasing the real green power share in Germany's electricity consumption, thus driving the energy transition forward.

"Be part of something unique, the first of its kind in Germany. Join us at RABOT Energy and seize abundant growth opportunities in the thriving world of green energy. We're a team that believes in the power of our mission, and we're looking for individuals with the passion to match ours!”

Jan Rabe, CEO

At RABOT Energy, we cherish cognitive diversity as a cornerstone of our global culture and a driving force behind our mission to craft truly representative and impactful products for a sustainable future. We wholeheartedly embrace diversity in all its dimensions and recognize that each person contributes to our shared endeavour of assisting individuals in transitioning to green energy.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities


Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.


How You Will Contribute


Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value


By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile


5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.


We as a Team

We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.

Our offer


100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!


Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application <3

About Us

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N°1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Ready to join us?
Show more
HTML:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
  • Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
  • Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
  • Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
  • Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
  • Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
  • Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
  • Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
  • Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.

How You Will Contribute

  • Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
  • Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
  • Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
  • Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value

By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile

  • 5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Wir suchen Dich als Business Intelligence Consultant




InfoFabrik ist ein dynamisches und wachsendes mittelständisches Unternehmen mit einem zentralen Office in Berlin. Wir suchen nach einem erfahrenen und engagierten Business Intelligence Consultant (m/w/d), der unser Team unterstützt und maßgeschneiderte BI-Lösungen entwickelt, die unseren Kunden helfen, fundierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und ihre Geschäftsprozesse zu optimieren.




Was wir uns von dir wünschen:

mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich BI & Data
Erfolgreiches Informatikstudium oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation/Ausbildung
Sicherer Umgang mit SQL und Erweiterungen (PL/SQL, T-SQL oder vergleichbar)
Erfahrung im Datawarehousing
Business Analyse & Beratung von externen Kunden
Anforderungsanalyse, Spezifikation und Umsetzung
Stetige Optimierung der Entwicklungsprozesse
Konzeption von Testkonzepten und Implementierung der jeweiligen Testumgebung sowie Durchführung von Tests
Ausgeprägte Kunden- und Ergebnisorientierung
Strukturierte Arbeitsweise / analytisches Denken
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Wir haben tolle Aufgaben für dich:

Mitarbeit in verschiedenen parallelen Projekten mit viel Abwechslung im Arbeitsalltag
fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung mit kompetenten Kollegen und anspruchsvollen Aufgaben
kleine Teams und übersichtliche Projekte




Techstack:

ReportServer (eigene Software für BI Lösungen)
Oracle Datenbank, PL/SQL
SQL-Server, T/SQL




Unsere Benefits:

mobiles Arbeiten ist möglich (2x pro Woche im Office)
Deutschlandticket
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Teamevents




Was uns ausmacht:

eine offene, wertschätzende und respektvolle Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe
starker Teamzusammenhalt dank flacher Hierarchien und schneller Entscheidungen




Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt und Du hast Lust ein Teil unseres Teams zu werden, dann sende uns Deine Bewerbung an personal@InfoFabrik.de

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (d/f/m) in Customer Service
Description:
mobile.de is Germany's largest vehicle marketplace with about 1.4 million listed cars, trucks, and motorcycles. Both private customers and more than 40,000 registered vehicle dealers use the platform. Including listing exports to the sister platform Kleinanzeigen, mobile.de reaches about 20 million unique users per month (AGMA digital facts; mobile.de and Kleinanzeigen; categories: cars, motorcycles, commercial vehicles, motorhomes; Ø month April 2022 to March 2023). As a "one-stop shop," mobile.de offers not only buying and selling services but also financing and leasing solutions, among others. The company, founded in 1996, is a subsidiary of Adevinta, a globally leading provider of online classifieds portals.

mobile.de is part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist and sustainability leader with 25+ products in 10 countries.

What You’ll Do & Who You Are

Join Us: Shape the Future of Customer Experience with Data! Be Our Data Hero!

Are you driven by the power of data to transform customer experiences? Do you crave a role where your insights directly fuel our success? We're looking for a passionate CS Data Analyst to join our team in Berlin and help us redefine customer service.

Join our dynamic Customer Service team at mobile.de. You'll be an important player amongst 16 internal colleagues and collaborate with 100+ external partners, reporting to our Manager of External Customer Service.

What You'll Achieve With Us


Unlock Customer Secrets: Dive deep into user behavior and reveal the hidden patterns that drive satisfaction.
Fuel Our Growth: Turn your data discoveries into actionable strategies that optimize our operations and elevate customer happiness.
Innovate & Inspire: Collaborate with our team to build cutting-edge dashboards and reporting tools that empower data-driven decisions.
Make a Real Impact: Directly influence our KPIs and see your recommendations translate into tangible improvements.
Be a Key Player: Partner with stakeholders across the company to ensure data accuracy and consistency, becoming a trusted advisor.


You'll Thrive Here If You


Are excited to contribute to a team that values data-driven innovation.
Have 3+ years of experience in an analyst role, and are ready to bring your skills to a dynamic customer service environment.
Possess a strong command of business intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.) and data querying languages (SQL, Python, R).
Understand the critical importance of customer service metrics (CSAT, NPS, etc.) and how they impact our success.
Are fluent in English and have good German skills, enabling seamless collaboration with our diverse team.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field, and are eager to apply your knowledge in a real-world setting.
Are ready to translate complex data into clear, actionable strategies that propel our team forward.


Why Join Us? We're not just looking for an analyst – we're looking for someone to join our mission. You'll be part of a team that's passionate about delivering exceptional customer experiences, and you'll have the opportunity to make a real difference. If you're ready to use your data skills to shape the future of customer service, we want to hear from you!

Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary 💸
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) 🏆
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We’re proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 – but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide




Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon







Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

Show more

Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.


Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)


Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company


What you would do:


Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.


You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.


  • Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
  • Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
  • Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions



What this job requires:


  • 4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
  • Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
  • Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
  • Experience with Git and Docker


Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.


What Zertificon offers you


  • Flexible working hours and home office possible
  • Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
  • Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
  • Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
  • Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
  • Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
  • Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 – but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
  • Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
  • Great market potential worldwide


Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon



Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data based at our HQ in Berlin - Schöneberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years’ experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You’ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe’s automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: Data Analyst in Bioinformatics and Ecology (f/m/x)
Description:
The Department of Evolutionary and Integrative Ecology at the Leibniz Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries (IGB, www.igb-berlin.de) invites applications for a Data Analyst focusing on genomic and ecological data. The position will be located in Berlin-Dahlem. It will also include managing and analysing large datasets and supporting IGB’s Competence and Technology Platform on Research Data Management.

Your role


Process and analyse genomic and molecular data from environmental samples and non-model organisms
Manage and analyse experimental and field data
Write data management plans and support researchers in the department to implement these plans following best practices
Support IGB research teams as a member of the IGB Research Data Management group
Apply and support the development of data visualisation tools


Your profile


University degree in bioinformatics, computational ecology, statistics, computer science, data science, or equivalent expertise, including from the private sector
Competence in R and one or more additional programming languages (e.g. Python, C++, C#)
Experience in data mining, scholarly databases, and the management, curation and analysis of data following FAIR data principles and Open Science practices
Very good English communication skills; German skills desirable
Excellent social skills, service orientation and ability to work in an international and diverse team
Prior knowledge of freshwater science is advantageous


Our offer

We offer an international and dynamic work environment located in our new Joint Biodiversity Building in Berlin-Dahlem. You will become part of a motivated team that encourages active participation and new ideas. We promote your professional development through qualifications and further training opportunities, and we actively support the compatibility of family and career.

This is a full-time position, but it is also suitable for part-time work. You will be paid according to the collective agreement for the public sector (TVöD Bund) and benefit from flexible working hours, a 39-hour work week, 30 days of vacation, a company pension scheme, and a subsidy for public transportation. The contract is initially limited to two years with the option of permanent employment. The salary class will be based on qualifications and assigned duties.

Given our commitment to diversity, we welcome all applications, regardless of gender and gender identity, origin, nationality, religion, belief, health and physical disabilities, age or sexual orientation. IGB is committed to increasing the number of women in this field, therefore applications from women are particularly welcome. Various measures are in place at IGB to support gender equality. We support the reconciliation of work and family life. Applicants with a disability will be given preference if they are equally qualified.

Are you interested?

Then apply by 06.04.2025 by submitting your documents (up to 2-page cover letter, CV, certificates/references, brief overview of your past projects) and stating the reference number 06/2025 exclusively via our recruitment platform at www.igb-berlin.de/en/jobs. Any questions can be directed to Jonathan Jeschke (Jonathan.Jeschke@igb-berlin.de).

"Research for the future of our freshwaters" is the mission of IGB – Germany’s largest and one of the leading international centres for freshwater research. In order to investigate different aspects of freshwater ecosystems, their biota and societal relevance, we unite a wide range of disciplines and understand research as a joint effort. With more than 350 employees and guests from all over the world, we conduct research at five locations in Berlin and at Lake Stechlin (Brandenburg). IGB is a member of the German Leibniz Association and the Forschungsverbund Berlin e. V. www.igb-berlin.de
Show more

Title: Data Analyst with ML Experience (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Analyst to join Billie’s Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie’s analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who we are looking for


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

Title: (Senior) Business Intelligence | Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Bei Superchat gestalten wir die Kommunikation zwischen Unternehmen und ihren Kund*innen neu. Unsere Mission ist klar: Die Kommunikation mit einem Unternehmen sollte so einfach und natürlich sein wie ein Gespräch mit deinen Freunden.




Superchat ist aktuell stark am Wachsen und damit stehen viele spannende Themen an. Wir suchen dich als Unterstützung! 🚀


So könnte dein Tag aussehen:



Du baust unsere erste BI-Infrastruktur und Reporting-Systeme auf, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen und unser Wachstum zu unterstützen


Du erstellst Datenpipelines und Modelle, die Daten effizient strukturieren und als Grundlage für Analysen und Berichte dienen


Du analysierst große Datensätze, übersetzt sie in klare Insights und unterstützt damit wichtige Entscheidungen


Du arbeitest eng mit Stakeholdern zusammen, um Lösungen zu entwickeln und Fragen wie Marketing-Performance und ROI zu beantworten


Du führst Experimente durch, analysierst die Ergebnisse und entwickelst daraus Wachstumsstrategien für Sales und Marketing



Das bringst du mit:



Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Bereich Analytics oder BI, idealerweise mit Fokus auf Sales und Marketing in der B2B-SaaS-Branche


Du kennst dich mit der Verwaltung von Datenbanken und der Analyse großer und komplexer Datensätze aus


Du beherrschst Visualisierungstools wie Looker und Tableau und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich darstellen


Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL, sowohl bei Abfragen als auch bei der Datenmanipulation


Du hast Erfahrung mit dem Aufbau von Datenpipelines und Datenmodellen, um Daten effizient zu strukturieren


Du bist fließend in Deutsch und Englisch bei Wort und Schrift



Deine Benefits:



Du genießt eine attraktive Vergütung


Du nutzt ein jährliches Budget für deine persönliche Weiterbildung, das für Konferenzen, Kurse, Bücher oder einen Karrierecoach verwendet werden kann


Du wählst zwischen einer Urban Sports Club/John Reed Mitgliedschaft oder einem Fahrkarten-Abo


Du profitierst von einem starken Onboarding-Programm sowie regelmäßigen Coachings und Feedback, die deine professionelle Entwicklung fördern


Du erlebst eine integrative Start-up-Kultur mit starkem Team Spirit und nimmst an regelmäßigen Team Events teil, bei denen wir unsere Ideen teilen und Erfolge feiern





Das sind wir:




Superchat wurde 2020 in Berlin von Yilmaz und Mika gegründet. Mit schon über 5.000 Unternehmenskunden sind wir auf starkem Wachstumskurs. Mit einer Series A-Finanzierung von 15,6 Mio. US-Dollar werden wir unter anderem von den führenden Investoren Blossom Capital und 468 Capital unterstützt.




Wir bieten eine umfassende Messaging-Suite für Unternehmen, die alle Kommunikationskanäle (WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook und viele mehr) in einer Plattform vereint. Das ermöglicht unseren Kunden, auf einfache Art und Weise Newsletter zu versenden, Kundenbeziehungen aufzubauen und Produkte und Dienstleistungen zu verkaufen.


Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass Diversität Unternehmen besser macht. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerber:innen. Unabhängig von Gender, Herkunft, Nationalität oder Glaube. Fühl dich frei und schicke uns gerne deine Bewerbung!


Mit deiner Bewerbung stimmst du unseren Datenschutzrichtlinien zu.




Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Show more
